newsitem.title: GERMANY: GERMAN UNILEVER SUBSIDIARY DEFENDS GENE-SOYA USE.
newsitem.headline: GERMAN UNILEVER SUBSIDIARY DEFENDS GENE-SOYA USE.

text.p: Union Deutsche Lebensmittelwerke GmbH, which is fully owned by Deutsche Unilever GmbH, on Thursday said soy oil derived from genetically-modified soybeans was identical with that from traditional beans.
A statement from Union said, "Unilever supports the responsible use of modern biotechnology within legal regulations as well as the supply of information on its applications."
"The use of genetically altered soybeans has been found completely safe by the relevant authorities in the U.S. and Europe." "Our own research reached the same conclusions."

Deutsche Unilever is part of Anglo-Dutch group Unilever, which was targeted on Wednesday by environmentalist group Greenpeace as part of a campaign against genetically-modified soybean imports from the U.S.
Greenpeace targeted Unilever as representative of the soya-processing food industry which it says ignores possible environmental and health risks from the new products.
Union said its products did not contain any gene-altered soya to date because the beans had not yet reached Europe.
